Codes & Alphabets

  //   Topics: Coding Theory

Alphabets

A q-ary alphabet is a set of q distinct symbols. For example, {0, 1} is a 2-ary alphabet with two symbols, 0 and 1, and is commonly called binary. A word is a finite sequence of symbols from some alphabet.

Codes

A q-ary code, usually denoted by C, is a (non-empty) set of words over a q-ary alphabet. The words in the set C are called codewords. If all codewords in C have the same length (number of characters) n, then C is a block code of length n.
